hw1

Class Radio

  • java.lang.Object
    • hw1.Radio

  • public class Radio
extends java.lang.Object
    Model of a radio.
    Author:
    RuchaKelkar

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static double VOLUME_INCREMENT
      The increment by which the volume increases.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Radio(double givenMinFrequency, double givenMaxFrequency, int givenNumStations)
      Constructs a Radio with the given range of frequencies and the given number of stations.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getFrequency()
      Returns the broadcast frequency for the current station.
      int getStationNumber()
      Returns the current station number.
      double getVolume()
      Returns the current volume.
      void setStationFromFrequency(double frequency)
      Sets the current station number to the one that corresponds to the broadcast frequency that is closest to the given double value (within range, otherwise will set to min/max value.)
      void setStationNumber(int stationNumber)
      Sets the station to the given station number.
      void stationDown()
      Sets the radio station down by 1, wrapping around if it goes below the number 0 station.
      void stationUp()
      Sets the radio station up by 1, wrapping around if it goes above the highest defined station.
      void volumeDown()
      Decreases the volume by VOLUME_INCREMENT, not going below 0.0.
      void volumeUp()
      Increases the volume by VOLUME_INCREMENT, not going above 1.0.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • VOLUME_INCREMENT

        public static double VOLUME_INCREMENT
        The increment by which the volume increases.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Radio

        public Radio(double givenMinFrequency,
             double givenMaxFrequency,
             int givenNumStations)
        Constructs a Radio with the given range of frequencies and the given number of stations.
        Parameters:
        givenMinFrequency - the lowest frequency for this Radio
        givenMaxFrequency - the highest frequency for this Radio
        givenNumStations - the number of stations for this Radio

    • Method Detail

      • getFrequency

        public double getFrequency()
        Returns the broadcast frequency for the current station.
        Returns:
        the current station's broadcast frequency

      • getStationNumber

        public int getStationNumber()
        Returns the current station number.
        Returns:
        the current station number

      • getVolume

        public double getVolume()
        Returns the current volume.
        Returns:
        the current volume

      • setStationFromFrequency

        public void setStationFromFrequency(double frequency)
        Sets the current station number to the one that corresponds to the broadcast frequency that is closest to the given double value (within range, otherwise will set to min/max value.)
        Parameters:
        frequency - the current frequency the radio is at

      • setStationNumber

        public void setStationNumber(int stationNumber)
        Sets the station to the given station number. If the number exceeds the range, it wraps around and sets to a valid station number.
        Parameters:
        stationNumber - the station number that the radio will be set to

      • stationDown

        public void stationDown()
        Sets the radio station down by 1, wrapping around if it goes below the number 0 station.

      • stationUp

        public void stationUp()
        Sets the radio station up by 1, wrapping around if it goes above the highest defined station.

      • volumeDown

        public void volumeDown()
        Decreases the volume by VOLUME_INCREMENT, not going below 0.0.

      • volumeUp

        public void volumeUp()
        Increases the volume by VOLUME_INCREMENT, not going above 1.0.
